member.name: T:TXTextControl.TXTextControl
member.summary: The TXTextControl JavaScript object provides a public API to manipulate the web editor via JavaScript functions in the browser.

member.summary: Specifies image file types.

member.summary: Specifies database file types.

member.summary: Determines a certain text format.

member.summary: Specifies HTML format (Hypertext Markup Language).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.StreamType.RichTextFormat

member.summary: Specifies Adobe Portable Document Format (PDF).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.StreamType.WordprocessingML
member.summary: Specifies Microsoft Word format (.DOCX version).

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.addEventListener
member.summary: The addEventListener function registers event listener functions on the TXTextControl object.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.focus
member.summary: The focus function sets the text input focus to the web editor.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getBackColor
member.summary: Returns the background color of the main text area and the ruler bars by calling a provided callback function.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getCultures
member.summary: Returns the culture and the UI culture of the control. The UI culture affects the string resource language. The culture represents date and time string formats, for example.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getFileDirectory
member.summary: Requests the directory path where the files of a specific file type are stored on the web server.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getFormattingPrinter
member.summary: Returns the name of the currently selected formatting printer by calling a provided callback function. For more information on the formatting printer see function setFormattingPrinter.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getInstalledPrinters
member.summary: Gets the names of the printers installed on the server which are usable by Text Control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getStatusBarColor
member.summary: Returns the background color of the status bar by calling a provided callback function.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.getTextParts
member.summary: Requests a collection of all text parts the current document contains from the server and returns the collection by calling a callback function which has to be provided as a parameter to the function.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.loadDocument
member.summary: Loads text in a certain format. The complete contents of the web editor are replaced.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.loadSelection
member.summary: Loads text in a certain format into the current selection.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.loadXMLDatabase
member.summary: Loads an XML database which is used to create table and field name menu items in the mailings ribbon tab.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.removeEventListener
member.summary: The removeListener function removes the specified listener from the TXTextControl object.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.removeFromDom
member.summary: The removeFromDom function closes the WebSocket connection gracefully and removes the whole editor from the DOM.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.resetContents
member.summary: Deletes the entire contents of the control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.saveDocument
member.summary: Saves the current document in a certain format and sends the result back asynchronously by calling a given callback function.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.saveSelection
member.summary: Saves the current selection in a certain format and sends the result back asynchronously by calling a given callback function.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.setBackColor
member.summary: Sets the background color of the main text area and the ruler bars.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.setFileDirectory
member.summary: Sets the directory path where the files of a specific file type are stored on the web server.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.setFormattingPrinter
member.summary: Sets the name of a printer the text dimensions and capabilities of which are used to format the document. If the document is printed with this printer the displayed and the printed document have the same dimensions. If the property is set to "Standard", the system installed standard printer is used to format the document. If the property is set to "Display", the font dimensions of the display device are used to format the document. If the specified printer is not installed, the standard printer is used.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.setStatusBarColor
member.summary: Sets the background color of the status bar.

member.summary: Shows or hides the web editor's horizontal ruler bar.

member.summary: Shows or hides the web editor's status bar.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TXTextControl.showVerticalRuler
member.summary: Shows or hides the web editor's vertical ruler bar.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.AppendSettings
member.summary: Determines how text is appended to the document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.AppendSettings.None
member.summary: The loaded text is inserted at the end of the last paragraph of the existing document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.AppendSettings.StartWithNewParagraph
member.summary: A new paragraph is created at the end of the document and the text is inserted in this paragraph.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.AppendSettings.StartWithNewSection
member.summary: A new section is created at the end of the document and the text is inserted in this section.

member.summary: Determines the format of an ApplicationField.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldFormat.MSWord
member.summary: The field is supported and defined through Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldFormat.HighEdit
member.summary: The field is supported and defined through the Heiler HighEdit component.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.AutoSizeDirection
member.summary: Determines values for the AutoSize.AutoExpand and AutoSize.AutoShrink properties.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.AutoSizeDirection.None
member.summary: The control does not shrink automatically.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.AutoSizeDirection.Vertical
member.summary: The control automatically shrinks vertically.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.AutoSizeDirection.Horizontal
member.summary: The control automatically shrinks horizontally.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.AutoSizeDirection.Both
member.summary: The control automatically shrinks in both directions.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.BinaryStreamType
member.summary: Determines a certain text format that must tbe stored in a one-dimensional byte array.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.BinaryStreamType.AdobePDF
member.summary: Specifies Adobe Portable Document Format (PDF). If a document is loaded, only the text is imported.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.BinaryStreamType.AdobePDFA
member.summary: Specifies Adobe Portable Document Format Archive (PDF/A). This format can only be used in saving operations.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.BinaryStreamType.InternalFormat
member.summary: Specifies the internal Text Control format. Text is stored in ANSI format.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.BinaryStreamType.InternalUnicodeFormat
member.summary: Specifies the internal Text Control format. Text is stored in Unicode format.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.BinaryStreamType.MSWord
member.summary: Specifies Microsoft Word format.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.BinaryStreamType.WordprocessingML
member.summary: Specifies Microsoft Word format (Office Open XML version).

member.summary: The menu context is a PageNumberField.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ControlChars
member.summary: Determines values for the control characters used in a TextControl document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ControlChars.ParagraphEnd
member.summary: Defines the end of a paragraph (Keyboard: ENTER).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ControlChars.LineBreak
member.summary: Defines a line break without beginning a new paragraph (Keyboard: SHIFT+ENTER).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ControlChars.PageBreak
member.summary: Defines a page break (Keyboard: CTRL+ENTER).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ControlChars.ColumnBreak
member.summary: Defines a page column break (Keyboard: CTRL+SHIFT+ENTER).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ControlChars.Tab
member.summary: Defines a tabulator (Keyboard: TAB).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ControlChars.NonBreakingSpace
member.summary: Defines a non-breaking space (Keyboard: CTRL+SHIFT+Space).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ControlChars.NonVisibleHyphen
member.summary: Defines a non-visible hyphen (Keyboard: CTRL+(-)).

member.name: T:TXTextControl.CursorKind
member.summary: Determines the kind of the cursor at a certain location in a document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.IBeam
member.summary: The cursor is an I-beam.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.ArrowNE
member.summary: The cursor is an arrow cursor pointing to northeast.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.VSplit
member.summary: The cursor is a vertical splitting cursor.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.UpArrow
member.summary: The cursor is an up arrow cursor.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.Arrow
member.summary: The cursor is a standard arrow cursor pointing to northwest.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.DownArrow
member.summary: The cursor is a down arrow cursor.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.SizeWE
member.summary: The cursor is a two-headed horizontal (west/east) sizing cursor.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.SizeNS
member.summary: The cursor is the two-headed vertical (north/south) sizing cursor.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.SizeNWSE
member.summary: The cursor is the two-headed diagonal (northwest/southeast) sizing cursor.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.SizeNESW
member.summary: The cursor is the two-headed diagonal (northeast/southwest) sizing cursor.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.SizeAll
member.summary: The cursor is the four-headed sizing cursor, which consists of four joined arrows that point north, south, east, and west.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.Cross
member.summary: The cursor is the crosshair cursor.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.No
member.summary: The cursor is the cursor that indicates that a particular region is invalid for the current operation.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.DragDropCopy
member.summary: The cursor is the standard cursor for copying data during a drag and drop operation.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.CursorKind.DragDropMove
member.summary: The cursor is the standard cursor for moving data during a drag and drop operation.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode
member.summary: Determines how the frame of an image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing can be inserted in the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter
member.summary: The frame is inserted in the text as a single character.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.DisplaceCompleteLines
member.summary: The frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text stops at the top and continues at the bottom of the frame.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.DisplaceText
member.summary: The frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text flows around the frame and empty areas at the left and right side are filled.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.AboveTheText
member.summary: The frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location above the text. This means that the frame overwrites the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.BelowTheText
member.summary: The frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location below the text. This means that the text overwrites the frame.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText
member.summary: The frame is anchored to a paragraph and moved with the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage
member.summary: The frame is fixed positioned on a page.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat
member.summary: Determines a certain clipboard format that can be pasted into a TextControl document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.Barcode
member.summary: Specifies a barcode.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.Chart
member.summary: Specifies a chart.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.HTMLFormat
member.summary: Specifies HTML format (Hypertext Markup Language).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.Image
member.summary: Specifies an image. An image can be pasted, if it is a device dependent or a device independent bitmap, a TIFF image or a Windows metafile.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.PlainText
member.summary: Specifies unformatted text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.RichTextFormat
member.summary: Specifies RTF format (Rich Text Format).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.TXTextControlFormat
member.summary: Specifies formatted text in the internal TX Text Control format.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.TXTextControlImage
member.summary: Specifies an image including information about how the image is positioned in the document (inline or geometrically positioned).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ClipboardFormat.TXTextControlTextframe
member.summary: Specifies a TX Text Control textframe including its contents. The clipbord contains also information about how the textframe is positioned in the document (inline or geometrically positioned).

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Direction
member.summary: Determines the writing direction of a paragraph.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Direction.LeftToRight
member.summary: The writing direction is left to right, which means that blocks of text with left to right and right to left characters are ordered from left to right.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.Direction.RightToLeft
member.summary: The writing direction is right to left, which means that blocks of text with left to right and right to left characters are ordered from right to left.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.FindOptions
member.summary: Determines search options for the Find methods.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FindOptions.MatchCase
member.summary: Locates only instances of the search text that have the exact casing.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FindOptions.MatchWholeWord
member.summary: Locates only instances of the search text which are whole words.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FindOptions.NoHighlight
member.summary: The search text, if found, is not highlighted.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FindOptions.NoMessageBox
member.summary: Does not display message boxes to inform about search results.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.FindOptions.Reverse
member.summary: The search starts at the end of the control's document and searches to the beginning of the document.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType
member.summary: Determines the type of a header or footer.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.Header
member.summary: The object is a header. When an even header exists, the object represents the odd header. Otherwise it represents the header of all pages.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.FirstPageHeader
member.summary: The object represents a special header of the document's or section's first page.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.Footer
member.summary: The object is a footer. When an even footer exists, this member represents the odd footer. Otherwise it represents the footer of all pages.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.FirstPageFooter
member.summary: The object represents a special footer of the document's or section's first page.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.EvenHeader
member.summary: The object represents an even header.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HeaderFooterType.EvenFooter
member.summary: The object represents an even footer.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Determines values for the horizontal alignment of the text or of text frames, images and charts.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment.Left
member.summary: The alignment is left aligned.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment.Right
member.summary: The alignment right aligned.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment.Center
member.summary: The alignment is centered.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment.Justify
member.summary: The alignment is justified. This value is only used with text. It cannot be used with text frames, images and charts.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode
member.summary: Determines how an Image can be inserted in the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.AsCharacter
member.summary: The image is inserted in the text as a single character.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.DisplaceCompleteLines
member.summary: The image is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text stops at the top and continues at the bottom of the image.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.DisplaceText
member.summary: The image is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text flows around the image and empty areas at the left and right side are filled.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.AboveTheText
member.summary: The image is inserted at a certain geometrical location above the text. This means that the image overwrites the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.BelowTheText
member.summary: The image is inserted at a certain geometrical location below the text. This means that the text overwrites the image.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.MoveWithText
member.summary: The image is anchored to a paragraph and moved with the text. This member cannot be used with the ImageCollection.Add methods.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode.FixedOnPage
member.summary: The image is fixed positioned on a page. This member cannot be used with the ImageCollection.Add methods.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ListType
member.summary: Specifies the kind of a bulleted or numbered list.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ListType.None
member.summary: The text is neither a bulleted nor a numbered list.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ListType.Bulleted
member.summary: The list is a bulleted list.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ListType.Numbered
member.summary: The list is a numbered list.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ListType.Structured
member.summary: The list is a structured list. All numbers of higher levels (lower level numbers) are displayed in front of the list number. The additional text of all levels in front and behind the list numbers is also displayed.

member.summary: Specifies all misspelled words which are marked as ignored.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordKind.Normal
member.summary: Specifies all misspelled words which do not have a special meaning.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.StreamType
member.summary: Determines a certain text format.

member.summary: Specifies Adobe Portable Document Format (PDF). If a document is loaded, only the text is imported.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.AdobePDFA
member.summary: Specifies Adobe Portable Document Format Archive (PDF/A). This format can only be used in saving operations.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.CascadingStylesheet
member.summary: Specifies CSS format (Cascading Style Sheet). This format can only be used in saving operations.

member.summary: Specifies HTML format (Hypertext Markup Language).

member.summary: Specifies the internal Text Control format. Text is stored in Unicode format.

member.summary: Specifies Microsoft Word format (.DOC version).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.PlainText
member.summary: Specifies text in Windows Unicode format (an end of a paragraph is marked with the control characters 13 and 10).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.RichTextFormat

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.WordprocessingML
member.summary: Specifies Microsoft Word format (Office Open XML version).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StreamType.XMLFormat

member.summary: Specifies HTML format (Hypertext Markup Language).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StringStreamType.PlainText
member.summary: Specifies Text in Windows Unicode format (an end of a paragraph is marked with the control characters 13 and 10).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StringStreamType.RichTextFormat
member.summary: Specifies RTF format (Rich Text Format).

member.name: F:TXTextControl.StringStreamType.XMLFormat
member.summary: Specifies XML format (Extensible Markup Language).

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TableAddPosition
member.summary: Specifies the position where to add table rows and columns or where to split a table.

member.summary: Table rows or columns are inserted or the table is split in front of the row or column with the current input position.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TableAddPosition.After
member.summary: Table rows or columns are inserted or the table is split behind the row or column with the current input position.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextFieldPosition
member.summary: Specifies special text input positions at the beginning and the end of a TextField.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldPosition.InsideTextField
member.summary: The specified position is inside the field.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldPosition.OutsideTextField
member.summary: The specified position is outside the field.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldPosition.InsideNextTextField
member.summary: The specified position is inside the next field. This member is only possible, if there are two following text fields without any character bewteen the fields. In this case InsideTextField is in the first field, OutsideTextField is between the fields and InsideNextTextField is in the second field.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextFieldType
member.summary: Specifies types of text fields.

member.summary: The field type is TXTextControl.HypertextLink.

member.summary: The field type is TXTextControl.PageNumberField.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldType.TextField
member.summary: The field type is TXTextControl.TextField.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldType.ApplicationField
member.summary: The field type is TXTextControl.ApplicationField.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFieldType.All
member.summary: Specifies all types of text fields.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode
member.summary: Determines how a TextFrame can be inserted in the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter
member.summary: The text frame is inserted in the text as a single character.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.DisplaceCompleteLines
member.summary: The text frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text stops at the top and continues at the bottom of the text frame.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.DisplaceText
member.summary: The text frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location. The text flows around the text frame and empty areas at the left and right side are filled.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.AboveTheText
member.summary: The text frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location above the text. This means that the text frame overwrites the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.BelowTheText
member.summary: The text frame is inserted at a certain geometrical location below the text. This means that the text overwrites the text frame.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText
member.summary: The text frame is anchored to a paragraph and moved with the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage
member.summary: The text frame is fixed positioned on a page.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ZoomOption
member.summary: Specifies options how to set the zoom factor of a TextControl.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZoomOption.PageWidth
member.summary: The zoom factor is calculated so that the complete width of a page becomes visible.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZoomOption.TextWidth
member.summary: The zoom factor is calculated so that the complete text of a line becomes visible.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZoomOption.WholePage
member.summary: The zoom factor is calculated so that the current visible page becomes completely visible.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ZOrder
member.summary: Specifies how the z-order of a frame (image, text frame, chart, barcode or drawing) can be changed.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.Bottom
member.summary: If the frame is in front of the text, it becomes the bottommost of all objects in front of the text. If it is behind the text, it is becomes the bottommost of all objects.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.BottomMost
member.summary: The frame is moved behind the text below all other objects. This member is only possible, if the insertion mode is BehindTheText.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.Down
member.summary: The frame is moved down one plane. If it is the bottommost object in front of the text, it is not moved behind the text.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.TopMost
member.summary: The frame is moved in front of the text at the top of all other objects.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.Top
member.summary: If the frame is behind the text, it becomes the topmost of all objects behind the text. If it is in front of the text, it becomes the topmost of all objects.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.ZOrder.Up
member.summary: The frame is moved up one plane. If it is the topmost object behind the text, it is not moved in front of the text.

member.summary: Inserts a new object of the type ApplicationField at the current input position.

member.summary: Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at a particular index.

Specifies the index of the destination array at which to begin copying.

member.summary: Gets the field at the current input position or null, if there is no such field at the current input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldCollection.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the field with the specified id, previously set with the ID property.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.ApplicationField)
member.summary: Removes a field of the type ApplicationField including its visible text from a TX Text Control document.
member.param: Specifies the field to remove.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ApplicationFieldCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.ApplicationField,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes a field of the type ApplicationField from a TX Text Control document. The visible text is deleted depending on the keepText parameter.
member.param: Specifies the field to remove.
If this parameter is set to true, the field is removed without deleting its visible text.

member.summary: The file contains not well-formed syntax.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.ImageCollection
member.summary: An instance of the ImageCollection class contains all images in a Text Control document or part of the document represented through objects of the type Image.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add
member.summary: Inserts an image inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The image is inserted at the current text input position. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts an image inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The image is inserted at the specified text input position. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the text position at which the image is to be inserted.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment,System.Int32,TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a new image which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified horizontal alignment and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored images are moved with the text. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the image's horizontal alignment.
Specifies the text position at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32,TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a new image which is anchored to the specified text position. It has the specified location relative to the paragraph it is anchored to and a textflow which is given through the insertionMode parameter. Anchored images are moved with the text. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies the text position at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the number of a page beginning with 1 where the image is located.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ImageCollection.Add(TXTextControl.Image,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.ImageInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a new image which has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a location relative to the top left corner of the complete document. All gaps between the pages must be included. A file open dialog box is shown to get the image's file name and filter. To avoid opening the dialog box set the Image.FileName and the Image.FilterIndex properties of the specified Image object.
member.param: Specifies the image to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the image is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word at the current text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word is returned. If there is no misspelled word between the current input position and the end of the text, the first word is returned.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem(TXTextControl.MisspelledWordKind)
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word of the specified kind at the current text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word of is returned. If there is no misspelled word of the specified kind between the current input position and the end of the text, the first word of the specified kind is returned.
member.param: Specifies the word's kind.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word at a certain geometrical location. If there is no misspelled word, null is returned.
member.param: Specifies the word's location.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word at the specified text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word is returned. If there is no misspelled word between the specified input position and the end of the text, the first word is returned.
member.param: Specifies a zero-based text postion.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.GetItem(System.Int32,TXTextControl.MisspelledWordKind)
member.summary: Gets the misspelled word of the specified kind at the specified text input position. If there is no misspelled word, the next possible word is returned. If there is no misspelled word of the specified kind between the specified input position and the end of the text, the first word of the specified kind is returned.
member.param: Specifies a zero-based text postion.
Specifies the word's kind.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.Ignore(TXTextControl.MisspelledWord,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the text of the specified misspelled word and marks it as ignored. Ignored misspelled words are not underlined with a red zigzag line.

Specifies the changed text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.Item
member.summary: Gets a misspelled word from the collection. In C# this property is the indexer for the MisspelledWordCollection class.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.MisspelledWord)
member.summary: Removes the specified misspelled word from a Text Control document. The method removes the word's reference in the list of misspelled words, but not the word's text in the document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.MisspelledWordCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.MisspelledWord,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified misspelled word from a Text Control document. The method removes the word's reference in the list of misspelled words and replaces the word's text with the specified text.
member.param: Specifies the misspelled word to remove.
Specifies the corrected text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.ChangeDirection(TXTextControl.Direction)
member.summary: Changes the writing direction of all selected paragraphs. When the direction of a paragraph is changed, this paragraph's alignment is toggled from left to right or from right to left. The alignment of centered and justified paragraphs is not changed. Left and right tabulators are also toggled.
member.param: Specifies the writing direction.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.DecreaseIndent
member.summary: Decreases the left indent of all paragraphs contained in the current text selection. If no text is selected, this method decreases the left indent at the text input position. Left indent positions are defined through the paragraphs' tab positions and the indents of the paragraphs in front and behind the paragraph with the text input position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.GrowFont
member.summary: Increases the font size of each font contained in the current text selection. If no text is selected, this method increases the font size at the text input position. The font sizes used with this method are the same as shown through the ButtonBar or the built-in font dialog.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Selection.IncreaseIndent
member.summary: Increases the left indent of all paragraphs contained in the current text selection. If no text is selected, this method increases the left indent at the text input position. left indent positions are defined through the paragraphs' tab positions and the indents of the paragraphs in front and behind the paragraph with the text input position.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SubTextPart
member.summary: A SubTextPart object represents a user-defined part of a TX Text Control document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPart.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a subtextpart with the specified name and/or id. The start and length of the subtextpart are initialized to zero. When a zero-length subtextpart is inserted, the current text selection defines it position and length.
member.param: Specifies the name of the subtextpart.
Specifies an identifier for the subtextpart.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPart.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a subtextpart with the specified name, id, start position and length.
member.param: Specifies the name of the subtextpart.
Specifies an identifier for the subtextpart.
Specifies the index (one-based) of the first character which belongs to the subtextpart.
Specifies the number of characters which belong to the subtextpart.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection
member.summary: Contains all subtextparts in the main text or another main part of a document.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult
member.summary: Specifies the result when a subtextpart has been added to the document.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.AlreadyExists
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because it already exists.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Combined
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted but it was combined with an existing one. A subtextpart is combined with an existing one, when it immediately follows it and has the same name and id.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Error
member.summary: An unexpected error has occurred.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.NoSelection
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because there is no selection.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Overlapping
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because it overlaps with an existing textpart.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.PositionInvalid
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because the specified position values are invalid. Invalid start and/or length values have been specified.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.SelectionTooComplex
member.summary: The subtextpart wasn't inserted because the selection is too complex. It is not a continuous sequence of characters.

member.name: F:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.AddResult.Successful
member.summary: The subtextpart has successfully been inserted.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.Add(TXTextControl.SubTextPart)
member.summary: Adds a new subtextpart to the document. Its position is defined through the SubTextPart.Start and SubTextPart.Length properties. If the subtextpart's length is zero, the current text selection is used to define the position.
member.param: Specifies the subtextpart to add.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at a particular index.
member.param: Specifies the array to copy to.
Specifies the index of the destination array at which to begin copying.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.GetItem
member.summary: Gets the subtextpart at the current text input position. If there is more than one textpart at the current input position the textpart with the highest level is returned.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.GetItem(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the subtextpart with the specified name. The method returns null, if such a textpart does not exist. If more than one textpart with this name exists, the first found textpart is returned.
member.param: Specifies the textpart's name set with the Name property.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the subtextpart with the specified id. The method returns null, if such a textpart does not exist. If more than one textpart with this id exists, the first found textpart is returned.
member.param: Specifies the textpart's identifier.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.Item
member.summary: Gets the subtextpart with the specified number from the collection. The number must be between 1 and Count. In C# this property is the indexer for the SubTextPartCollection class.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.SubTextPart,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes a subtextpart from the collection including all its nested subtextparts.
member.param: Specifies the subtextpart to remove.
If this parameter is set to true, the subtextpart is removed without deleting its visible text.
If this parameter is set to true, nested subtextparts are preserved.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the collection.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Returns true if the collection is designed to be thread safe, otherwise, it returns false.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.SubTextPartCollection.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.SubTextPartEventArgs
member.summary: The SubTextPartEventArgs class provides data for the TextControl.SubTextPartClicked, TextControl.SubTextPartDoubleClicked, TextControl.SubTextPartEntered and TextControl.SubTextPartLeft events.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Table
member.summary: An instance of the Table class represents a table in a Text Control document.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.MergeCells
member.summary: Merges all selected table cells in this table. The Table.CanMergeCells property can be used to determine, if table cells can be merged or not.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.Select
member.summary: Selects the complete table.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.Select(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects the part of the table defined through two table cells.
member.param: Specifies the row number where the selection begins.
Specifies the column number where the selection begins.
Specifies the row number where the selection ends.
Specifies the column number where the selection ends.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.Split(TXTextControl.TableAddPosition)
member.summary: Splits a table below or above the current input position. If the table does not contain the current input position it cannot be split. The Table.CanSplit property can be used to determine if a table can be split or not. If a table is split above the first row a new line is inserted above the table and if a table is split below the last row a new line is inserted below the table. This is useful to insert text above or below a nested table that immediately starts and/or ends at the beginning or the end of the cell in which it is nested.
member.param: Specifies the position where to split the table.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Table.SplitCells
member.summary: Splits all selected table cells in this table. Only previously merged cells can be split. The Table.CanSplitCells property can be used to determine, if table cells can be split or not.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.CanMergeCells
member.summary: Checks whether table cells can be merged.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.CanSplit
member.summary: Checks whether this table can be split.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Table.CanSplitCells
member.summary: Checks whether previously merged table cells in this table can be split.

Specifies the text position where the search starts, beginning with 0.

member.summary: Invokes the built-in dialog box for choosing a color for the frame of a paragraph or a table.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.GetClipboardFormats
member.summary: Returns an array of ClipboardFormat values. These values specify all the data formats which are currently available in the clipboard and which can be pasted into a TextControl document. If there is no data format available, this method returns null.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.GetSupportedFonts
member.summary: Gets an array of strings specifying the names of all currently supported fonts. These fonts depend on the formatting device set with the TextControl.FormattingPrinter property. The method returns null, if the TextControl has not been completely initialized.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.GetSupportedPaperSizes
member.summary: Gets an array of PaperSize structures specifying the names and the size of all currently supported paper sizes. These paper sizes depend on the formatting device set with the TextControl.FormattingPrinter property. The method returns null, if the TextControl has not been completely initialized.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.GetTextFields(TXTextControl.TextFieldType)
member.summary: Returns a collection containing text fields of the specified types.
member.param: Specifies types of text fields.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.GetXmlElements(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a collection of XML elements. It is an object of the type XmlElementCollection.
member.param: Specifies the XML element's name.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.GetVersionInfo
member.summary: Returns an object of the type VersionInfo, which provides information about the installed TX Text Control version.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ImageAttributesDialog
member.summary: Opens the dialog box showing its first tab.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ImageAttributesDialog(System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens the dialog box showing the specified tab.
member.param: Specifies the index of the tab, zero-based, that is displayed when the tabbed dialog box is opened.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.LanguageDialog
member.summary: Invokes the built-in dialog box for setting the language of the selected text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ListFormatDialog
member.summary: Invokes the built-in dialog box for setting formatting attributes of bulleted and numbered lists.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.Paste
member.summary: Replaces the current selection in the Text Control with the contents of the Clipboard. If the data in the clipboard are provided in several formats, the format with the maximum of information is used.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetAutoControlSize
member.summary: Resets the AutoControlSize property to its default values. The default of the AutoControlSize property is a TextControl object that does not automatically expand or shrink its width or height.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetBackColor
member.summary: Overridden. Resets the BackColor property to its default value. The default value is the system color for the window background.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetContents
member.summary: Deletes the entire contents of a Text Control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetCursor
member.summary: Overridden. Resets the Cursor property to its default value. The default value is the IBeam cursor.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetDisplayColors
member.summary: Resets all display colors of a text control to their system dependent default values.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetFieldCursor
member.summary: Resets the FieldCursor property to its default value. The default value is the Hand cursor.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetForeColor
member.summary: Overridden. Resets the ForeColor property to its default value. The default value is the system color for the window text.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetPageMargins
member.summary: Resets the PageMargins property to its default value. The default page margins are 1 inch.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetPageSize
member.summary: Resets the PageSize property to its default value. The default page size is US letter (8,5 x 11 inch).

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.ResetTextBackColor
member.summary: Resets the TextBackColor property to its default value. The default value is the setting of the BackColor property.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors
member.summary: The TextControl.Colors class gets, sets or resets the display colors of a Windows Forms TextControl control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TextControl.Colors class. After creating the object with this constuctor, individual colors can be set. If the Colors object is assigned to the TextControl.DisplayColors property, non-set colors are reset to their system dependent default values.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.ResetDarkShadowColor
member.summary: Resets the text control's DarkShadowColor to its system dependent default value.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.ResetDesktopColor
member.summary: Resets the text control's DesktopColor to its system dependent default value.

member.summary: Resets the text control's HeaderFooterLabelColor to its system dependent default value.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.ResetHeaderFooterLineColor
member.summary: Resets the text control's HeaderFooterLineColor to its system dependent default value.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.ResetLightShadowColor
member.summary: Resets the text control's LightShadowColor to its system dependent default value.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.DarkShadowColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the display color for the shadow at the right and the bottom edge of the pages.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.DesktopColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the display color for the area around the pages.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.HeaderFooterLabelColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the display color for the label showing which header or footer is activated.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.HeaderFooterLineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the display color for the dividing line between headers and footers and the main text.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.TextControl.Colors.LightShadowColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the display color for the shadow at the left and the top edge of the pages.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFieldCollection.Remove(TXTextControl.TextField,System.Boolean)

If this parameter is set to true, the field is removed without deleting its text.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection
member.summary: An instance of the TextFrameCollection class contains all text frames in a Text Control document or part of the document represented through objects of the type TextFrame.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame inline, which means that it is treated in the text like a single character. The frame is inserted at the specified text position.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the text position at which the text frame is to be inserted.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,TXTextControl.HorizontalAlignment,System.Int32,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame which is anchored to the paragraph containing the specified text position. The frame has the specified horizontal alignment. TextFrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage and TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the text frame's horizontal alignment.
Specifies the text position at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame which is anchored to the paragraph containing the specified text position. The frame has the specified position relative to the paragraph containing its anchor position. TextFrameInsertionMode.FixedOnPage and TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies the text position at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame that has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This position is specified through a page number and a location on this page. TextFrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText and TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the number of a page beginning with 1 where the text frame is located.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,System.Drawing.Point,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame that has a fixed geometrical position in the document. This location is specified through a document position relative to the top left corner of the complete document. TextFrameInsertionMode.MoveWithText and TextFrameInsertionMode.AsCharacter cannot be specified with this overload.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies the location, in twips, at which the text frame is to be inserted.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.TextFrameCollection.Add(TXTextControl.TextFrame,TXTextControl.TextFrameInsertionMode)
member.summary: Inserts a text frame with the built-in mouse interface. The text frame's size is determined through the end-user. A cross cursor indicates where the text frame can be inserted. Changing the document or pressing the ESC key aborts the insertion process.
member.param: Specifies the text frame to add.
Specifies how the text flow is handled.

member.summary: Adds the specified XML element as a sub-element of this element. The new element is placed at the position specified through the document's DTD. If this element can have more than one child of the specified type, the before or after parameters can be used to specify a position.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.MailMerge.MergeObject(System.Object)

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.MailMerge.MergeObjects(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Interprets all public properties of the objects or the key names of the dictionaries in the collection as possible table columns and / or child tables. The type of the first object (or the key names and types of the first dictionary) in the collection is analyzed via .NET reflection and used as the basis of the assumed table structure. (In case of the collection containing objects of different types, the merge process is successful nevertheless, but some fields will be empty.) Properties of simple data types (e. g. string, int, enum) are converted to text using the ToString method. The textual representation of enum values can be specified using the System.ComponentModel.DescriptionAttribute. (For example: enum FoodCategory { [Description("Grains / Cereals")] Grains_Cereals, ... }.) The name by which Properties are mapped to field names can be adjusted using the System.ComponentModel.DisplayNameAttribute. (For example: [DisplayName("Name")] public string ProductName { get; set; }.) Complex properties which are themselves of type System.Collections.IEnumerable are interpreted as child Tables and used for merging merge blocks and nested merge blocks. This way data relations can be represented. Properties of a type itself having public properties are either interpreted as a simple table column (the merged text then is determined using the ToString() method) or they are treated as if they were a child table containing only one data row with the properties being the table columns. The second parameter specifies whether the single documents should be merged into one document or split into separate documents. The supported format of the merge fields can be found in the ASP.NET User's Guide.
member.param: Specifies a System.Collections.IEnumerable that contains the merge data.
Specifies whether the single documents should be merged into one document or split into separate documents.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.MailMerge.MergeObjects(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Does the same as MergeObjects with the parameter append set to true.
member.param: Specifies a System.Collections.IEnumerable that contains the merge data.

member.param: Specifies the document's name.
Specifies the name of the printer to which the output is sent.
Specifies the number of copies to print.
Collates output by printing every page of the first copy, then every page of the second copy, and so on.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.DataSources.DataSourceManager.LoadJson(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a JSON string containing an array of objects or a single object as a data source. Automatically deduces table and column names as well as data relations from property names and nested objects in the given single object or, in case of an array, the first object.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.DataSources.DataSourceManager.LoadObjects(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Loads a collection implementing the interface IEnumerable as a data source and deduces the data tables, column names and data relations from the public properties and used classes of the first contained object using .NET reflection or, in case of the first contained object being a Dictionary with string keys, from the key names and value types.
member.param: A collection implementing interface System.Collections.IEnumerable containing objects of any type.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.DataSources.DataSourceManager.LoadSingleObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Loads a single object which is either a Dictionary with string keys or an object of an arbitrary type as a data source. The data tables, column names are deduced either from the key names or the public property names and types using .NET reflection.
member.param: A single object which is either a Dictionary with string keys or an object of an arbitrary type as a data source.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.Json.InvalidCodePointException
member.summary: Is thrown when calling method MailMerge.MergeJsonData with a JSON string containing an invalid hexadecimal unicode code point.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.Json.InvalidNumberFormatException
member.summary: Is thrown when calling method MailMerge.MergeJsonData with a JSON string containing a number with an invalid number format.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.Json.ParserException
member.summary: Base class of all JSON parser related exceptions which can be thrown when calling method MailMerge.MergeJsonData with an incorrect JSON string.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.Json.UnexpectedEndOfInputException
member.summary: Is thrown when calling method MailMerge.MergeJsonData with an incomplete JSON string.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.Json.UnexpectedTokenException
member.summary: Is thrown when calling method MailMerge.MergeJsonData with a JSON string containing an unexpected character.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.Json.UnknownLiteralNameTokenException
member.summary: Is thrown when calling method MailMerge.MergeJsonData with a JSON string containing an unknown character sequence at a position where one of the strings "true", "false" or "null" are expected.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.DocumentServer.Json.UnknownParseErrorException
member.summary: Is thrown when calling method MailMerge.MergeJsonData and the internal JSON parser encounters an unknown error.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Drawing.MenuItem
member.summary: The Drawing.MenuItem class represents a bindable Windows Forms ToolStripMenuItem.

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection
member.summary: The Drawing.Selection class represents all selected shapes.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.BringForward
member.summary: Increases the selected shapes' levels by one. The method has no effect if the CanBringForward property returns false.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.BringToFront
member.summary: Displays the selected shape as the uppermost shape of all shapes. The method has no effect if the CanBringToFront property returns false.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.SendBackward
member.summary: Decreases the selected shapes' levels by one. The method has no effect if the CanSendBackward property returns false.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.SendToBack
member.summary: Displays the selected shape as the lowest shape of all shapes. The method has no effect if the CanSendToBack property returns false.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.IsCommonValueSelected(Drawing.Selection.Attribute)
member.summary: Informs about whether an attribute from the Drawing.Selection.Attribute enumeration has the same value for the complete shapes selection.
member.param: Specifies a possible value from the Drawing.Selection.Attribute enumeration.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.CanBringForward
member.summary: Gets value that indicates whether the selected shapes' levels can be increased by one.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.CanBringToFront
member.summary: Gets value that indicates whether the selected shape can be displayed as the uppermost shape of all shapes.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.CanSendBackward
member.summary: Gets value that indicates whether the selected shapes' levels can be decreased by one.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.CanSendToBack
member.summary: Gets value that indicates whether the selected shape can be displayed as the lowest shape of all shapes.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Selection.Shapes
member.summary: Gets or set the selected shapes .

member.name: T:TXTextControl.Drawing.Shape
member.summary: The Drawing.Shape class represents a shape which can be displayed inside the TX Drawing Control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Shape.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Shape class by the ShapeType type ShapeType.Custom.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Shape.#ctor(Drawing.ShapeType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Shape class by a specific ShapeType type.
member.param: Specifies the shape's type.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.Shape.FitToCanvas
member.summary: Expands the shape to the control's canvas size. The method has no effect if the CanFitToCanvas property returns false.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Shape.Angle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the shape inside the TX Drawing Control.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.Drawing.Shape.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the shape is automatically resized with the TX Drawing Control.

Specifies the position to draw on the specified System.Drawing.Graphics object.
Specifies whether the activated UI elements are rendered on the specified System.Drawing.Graphics object or not.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Drawing.TXDrawingControl.SizeToContent
member.summary: If any changes of the the displayed shapes' visible bounds require an adaption of the TX Drawing Control bounds, the size and/or location of the control is expanded respectively decreased by the considering value of the considering shape's side(s). The method returns an array of doubles which represent the effected alteration for each control's side (left, top, right, bottom) in Twips.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerVisualization.TextViewGenerator.BeginUndoAction(System.String)
member.summary: Begins a user-defined undo operation. All editing and fomatting changes made between BeginUndoAction and EndUndoAction belong to the undo operation. These changes are undone or redone in a single step. The specified user-defined name is available with the UndoActionName property.
member.param: Specifies the undo action's name.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerVisualization.TextViewGenerator.EndUndoAction
member.summary: Ends a user-defined undo operation. All editing and fomatting changes made between BeginUndoAction and EndUndoAction belong to the undo operation. These changes are undone or redone in a single step.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TextViewGenerator.Colors class. After creating the object with this constuctor, individual colors can be set. If the Colors object is assigned to the DisplayColors property, non-set colors are reset to their system dependent default values.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.ServerVisualization.View.GetUpdateRectangle(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the coordinates of the smallest rectangle that completely encloses the update region. When the document's visible part changes, a Changed event occurs and the changed part is added to the view's update region. The bValidate parameter can be used to reset the current update region to an empty rectangle. When the document's visible part changes because the document has been scrolled, the Changed event informs about the changed part, but it is not added to the update region.
member.param: Validates the current update region and resets it to an empty rectangle.

member.summary: Gets or sets the border style of the ruler bar.

member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the ruler bar's scale.

member.summary: The WPF.RulerBarColors class gets, sets or resets the display colors of a WPF.RulerBar control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.RulerBarColors.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WPF.RulerBarColors class. After creating the object with this constuctor, individual colors can be set. If the Colors object is assigned to the WPF.RulerBar.DisplayColors property, non-set colors are reset to their system dependent default values.

member.summary: Gets or sets the background color at the left or top edge of the ruler bar.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color used for the numbers of the ruler.

member.summary: Gets or sets the background color at the right or bottom edge of the ruler bar.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the ruler.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color of dark separators.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.RulerBarColors.SeparatorColorLight
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of light separators.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBar.ShowKeyStates
member.summary: Specifies whether the status bar shows the key state of the CAPSLOCK and the NUMLOCK key and the current insertion mode, insert or overwrite.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBar.ShowLanguage
member.summary: Specifies whether the status bar shows the language of the text selection or the text input position.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBar.ShowLine
member.summary: Specifies whether the status bar shows the line number of the current text input position.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBar.ShowPage
member.summary: Specifies whether the status bar shows the page number of the current text input position.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBar.ShowPageCounter
member.summary: Specifies whether the status bar shows the number of pages the document consists of.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBar.ShowSection

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBar.ShowSectionCounter
member.summary: Specifies whether the status bar shows the number of sections the document consists of.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBar.ShowZoom

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBar.ShowZoomTrackBar

member.name: T:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors
member.summary: The WPF.StatusBarColors class gets, sets or resets the display colors of a WPF.StatusBar control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WPF.StatusBarColors class. After creating the object with this constuctor, individual colors can be set. If the Colors object is assigned to the WPF.StatusBar.DisplayColors property, non-set colors are reset to their system dependent default values.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color at the left edge of the status bar.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.BackColorBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color at the bottom of the status bar.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.BackColorMiddle
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color in the middle of the status bar.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.BackColorTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color at the top of the status bar.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used for text and numbers.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.FrameColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the status bar's frames.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.GradientBackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color at the right edge of the status bar.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.SeparatorColorDark
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the dark part of a separator.

member.name: P:TXTextControl.WPF.StatusBarColors.SeparatorColorLight
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the light part of a separator.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.BeginUndoAction(System.String)
member.summary: Begins a user-defined undo operation. All editing and fomatting changes made between BeginUndoAction and EndUndoAction belong to the undo operation. These changes are undone or redone in a single step. The specified user-defined name is available with the UndoActionName property.
member.param: Specifies the undo action's name.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.Clear
member.summary: Clears the selected text or the character right from the current input position from the Text Control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.ClearUndo
member.summary: Clears the undo buffer of the Text Control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.Copy
member.summary: Copies the current selection in the Text Control to the Clipboard.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.Cut
member.summary: Moves the current selection in the Text Control to the Clipboard.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.DrawingLayoutDialog
member.summary: Opens the dialog box showing its first tab.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.DrawingLayoutDialog(System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens the dialog box showing the specified tab.
member.param: Specifies the index of the tab, zero-based, that is displayed when the tabbed dialog box is opened.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.EndUndoAction
member.summary: Ends a user-defined undo operation. All editing and fomatting changes made between BeginUndoAction and EndUndoAction belong to the undo operation. These changes are undone or redone in a single step.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.Find
member.summary: Opens the built-in Find dialog box to search for a text string in the text part with the input focus. This can be the main text, a text frame or a header or footer.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.Find(System.String)
member.summary: Searches for the specified text string in the text part with the input focus. This can be the main text, a text frame or a header or footer. The search starts at the beginning of the text.
member.param: Specifies the text to search for.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.Find(System.String,System.Int32,TXTextControl.FindOptions)
member.summary: Searches for the specified text string in the text part with the input focus. This can be the main text, a text frame or a header or footer. The search is done with the specified find options and starts at the specified position.
member.param: Specifies the text to search for.
Specifies the text position where the search starts, beginning with 0.
Specifies search options.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.GetClipboardFormats
member.summary: Returns an array of ClipboardFormat values. These values specify all the data formats which are currently available in the clipboard and which can be pasted into a document. If there is no data format available, this method returns null.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.GetSupportedFonts
member.summary: Gets an array of strings specifying the names of all currently supported fonts. These fonts depend on the formatting device set with the WPF.TextControl.FormattingPrinter property. The method returns null if the WPF.TextControl has not been completely initialized.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.GetSupportedPaperSizes
member.summary: Gets an array of PaperSize structures specifying the names and the size of all currently supported paper sizes. These paper sizes depend on the formatting device set with the WPF.TextControl.FormattingPrinter property.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.TextControl.GetTextFields(TXTextControl.TextFieldType)
member.summary: Returns a collection containing text fields of the specified types.
member.param: Specifies types of text fields.

member.summary: Returns a collection of XML elements. It is an object of the type XmlElementCollection.
member.param: Specifies the XML element's name.

member.summary: Returns an object of the type VersionInfo, which provides information about the installed TX Text Control version.

member.summary: Opens the standard print dialog to get printer settings and prints the document.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TXDrawingControl class.

member.summary: Clears the undo buffer of the TX Drawing Control.

member.summary: Copies the current selected shapes of the TX Drawing Control to the Clipboard.

member.summary: Moves the current selected shapes of the TX Drawing Control to the Clipboard.

member.summary: Opens a dialog to format selected shapes.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.Drawing.TXDrawingControl.Paste
member.summary: Pastes the content of the clipboard into the TX Drawing Control

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.Drawing.TXDrawingControl.PrintPaint(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Renders only the displayed shapes on the specified System.Drawing.Graphics object. No activated UI elements are rendered.
member.param: Specifies the object of type System.Drawing.Graphics the displayed shapes are rendered to.
Specifies the position to draw on the specified System.Drawing.Graphics object.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.Drawing.TXDrawingControl.PrintPaint(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Renders the displayed shapes on the specified System.Drawing.Graphics object with or without activated UI elements.
member.param: Specifies the object of type System.Drawing.Graphics the displayed shapes are rendered to.
Specifies the position to draw on the specified System.Drawing.Graphics object.
Specifies whether the activated UI elements are rendered on the specified System.Drawing.Graphics object or not.

member.summary: Redoes the last TX Drawing Control operation.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.Drawing.TXDrawingControl.SetCanvasSize(System.Double,System.Double)

member.param: Specifies the width of the canvas.
Specifies the height of the canvas.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.WPF.Drawing.TXDrawingControl.SizeToContent
member.summary: If any changes of the the displayed shapes' visible bounds require an adaption of the TX Drawing Control bounds, the size and/or location of the control is expanded respectively decreased by the considering value of the considering shape's side(s). The method returns an array of doubles which represent the effected alteration for each control's side (left, top, right, bottom) in twips.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Web.TextControl.LoadDataFromJson(System.String)

member.param: The JSON string containing the merge data.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Web.TextControl.LoadDataFromJsonAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Uses data given as a JSON string as a data source. The JSON string has to contain an array of equally structured objects. Analyzes and uses the given objects as merge data in the same way as the method LoadDataFromModel. The method returns immediately.
member.param: The JSON string containing the merge data.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Web.TextControl.LoadDataFromModel(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Interprets all public properties of the objects in the collection as possible table columns and / or child tables. The type of the first object in the collection is analyzed via .NET reflection and used as the basis of the assumed table structure. For more information about using object based data sources see DocumentServer.MailMerge.MergeObjects. The method returns immediately.
member.param: Specifies a System.Collections.IEnumerable that contains the merge data.

member.summary: Allows to additionally specify a format which should be applied when converting date / time values and numerical values to strings.

The format which should be applied when converting date / time values and numerical values to strings.

member.summary: The HorizontalRibbonGroup class represents a logical group of controls as they appear on a RibbonTab.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HorizontalRibbonGroup class.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Windows.Forms.Ribbon.HorizontalRibbonGroup.Add(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a control of type RibbonButton, RibbonComboBox, RibbonLabel, RibbonListView, RibbonTextBox or RibbonSeperator to the end of a specific row inside the horizontal ribbon group.
member.param: The control to be added to this group.
The row where to add the control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Windows.Forms.Ribbon.HorizontalRibbonGroup.AddRange(System.Windows.Forms.Control[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an array of controls to the end of a specific row. These controls must be objects of type RibbonButton, RibbonComboBox, RibbonLabel, RibbonListView, RibbonTextBox or RibbonSeperator.
member.param: An array of controls to be added to this group.
The row where to add the controls.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Windows.Forms.Ribbon.HorizontalRibbonGroup.Insert(System.Int32,System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a control of type RibbonButton, RibbonComboBox, RibbonLabel, RibbonListView, RibbonTextBox or RibbonSeperator at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index at which the control should be inserted.
The control to be inserted to this group.
The row where to insert the control.

member.name: M:TXTextControl.Windows.Forms.Ribbon.HorizontalRibbonGroup.InsertRange(System.Int32,System.Windows.Forms.Control[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts an array of controls at the specified index. These controls must be objects of type RibbonButton, RibbonComboBox, RibbonLabel, RibbonListView, RibbonTextBox or RibbonSeperator.
member.param: The zero-based index at which the controls should be inserted.
An array of controls to be inserted to this group.
The row where to insert the controls.
